item.title: Andy add a quote by Suzanne Collins
item.description: "As long as you can find yourself, youâ€™ll never starve." -- Suzanne Collins

item.title: Andy add a quote by Jonathan Safran Foer
item.description: "Sometimes I can hear my bones straining under the weight of all the lives I'm not living." -- Jonathan Safran Foer

item.title: Andy add a quote by Jane Austen
item.description: "There are few people whom I really love, and still fewer of whom I think well. The more I see of the world, the more am I dissatisfied with it; and every day confirms my belief of the inconsistency of all human characters, and of the little dependence that can be placed on the appearance of merit or sense." -- Jane Austen

item.title: Andy add a quote by Chuck Palahniuk
item.description: "The unreal is more powerful than the real. Because nothing is as perfect as you can imagine it. Because its only intangible ideas, concepts, beliefs, fantasies that last. Stone crumbles. Wood rots. People, well, they die. But things as fragile as a thought, a dream, a legend, they can go on and on. If you can change the way people think. The way they see themselves. The way they see the world. You can change the way people live their lives. That's the only lasting thing you can create." -- Chuck Palahniuk

item.title: Andy add a quote by Frank Herbert
item.description: "I must not fear. Fear is the mind-killer. Fear is the little-death that brings total obliteration. I will face my fear. I will permit it to pass over me and through me. And when it has gone past I will turn the inner eye to see its path. Where the fear has gone there will be nothing. Only I will remain." -- Frank Herbert

item.title: Andy add a quote by William Shakespeare
item.description: "The robb'd that smiles, steals something from the thief; He robs himself that spends a bootless grief." -- William Shakespeare

item.title: Andy add a quote by Arthur Golden
item.description: "At the temple there is a poem called "Loss" carved into the stone. It has three words, but the poet has scratched them out. You cannot read loss, only feel it." -- Arthur Golden

item.title: Andy add a quote by Peter S. Beagle
item.description: "I'll tell you something. Once I was very fond of a poem by Emily Dickinson or somebody. I only remember one line of it, but it goes, 'The soul selects her own society.' I used to tell it to everybody. Once I quoted it to a friend of mine, and he said, 'Maybe, but the body gets thrown into bed with the goddamnedest people." -- Peter S. Beagle

item.title: Andy add a quote by C.S. Lewis
item.description: "To love at all is to be vulnerable. Love anything and your heart will be wrung and possibly broken. If you want to make sure of keeping it intact you must give it to no one, not even an animal. Wrap it carefully round with hobbies and little luxuries; avoid all entanglements. Lock it up safe in the casket or coffin of your selfishness. But in that casket, safe, dark, motionless, airless, it will change. It will not be broken; it will become unbreakable, impenetrable, irredeemable. To love is to be vulnerable." -- C.S. Lewis

item.title: Andy add a quote by Marilynne Robinson
item.description: "Sometimes I have loved the peacefulness of an ordinary Sunday. It is like standing in a newly planted garden after a warm rain. You can feel the silent and invisible life." -- Marilynne Robinson

item.title: Andy add a quote by John Steinbeck
item.description: "I wonder how many people I've looked at all my life and never seen." -- John Steinbeck

item.title: Andy add a quote by John Steinbeck
item.description: "All great and precious things are lonely." -- John Steinbeck

item.title: Andy add a quote by John Steinbeck
item.description: "You're bound to get idears if you go thinkin' about stuff" -- John Steinbeck

item.title: Andy add a quote by John Steinbeck
item.description: "If you're in trouble, or hurt or need - go to the poor people. They're the only ones that'll help - the only ones." -- John Steinbeck

item.title: Andy add a quote by William Shakespeare
item.description: "This above all: to thine own self be true, And it must follow, as the night the day, Thou canst not then be false to any man." -- William Shakespeare

item.title: Andy add a quote by William Shakespear
item.description: "There is nothing either good or bad, but thinking makes it so." -- William Shakespear

item.title: Andy add a quote by Connie Willis
item.description: "Cats, as you know, are quite impervious to threats." -- Connie Willis

item.title: Andy add a quote by F. Scott Fitzgerald
item.description: "So we beat on, boats against the current, borne back ceaselessly into the past." -- F. Scott Fitzgerald

item.title: Andy add a quote by F. Scott Fitzgerald
item.description: "Itâ€™s a great advantage not to drink among hard drinking people." -- F. Scott Fitzgerald

item.title: Andy add a quote by F. Scott Fitzgerald
item.description: "I wasn't actually in love, but I felt a sort of tender curiosity." -- F. Scott Fitzgerald

item.title: Andy add a quote by F. Scott Fitzgerald
item.description: "Let us learn to show our friendship for a man when he is alive and not after he is dead." -- F. Scott Fitzgerald

item.title: Andy add a quote by John Champlin Gardner Jr.
item.description: "I couldn't go on, too conscious all at once of my whispering, my eternal posturing, always transforming the world with words--changing nothing." -- John Champlin Gardner Jr.

item.title: Andy add a quote by John Champlin Gardner Jr.
item.description: "There is no limit to desire but desire's needs." -- John Champlin Gardner Jr.

item.title: Andy add a quote by John Champlin Gardner Jr.
item.description: "I cannot believe such monstrous energy of grief can lead to nothing!" -- John Champlin Gardner Jr.

item.title: Andy add a quote by Barbara Kingsolver
item.description: "Donâ€™t try to make life a mathematics problem with yourself in the center and everything coming out equal. When youâ€™re good, bad things can still happen. And if youâ€™re bad, you can still be lucky." -- Barbara Kingsolver

item.title: Andy add a quote by Bernard Schlink
item.description: "Sometimes the memory of happiness cannot stay true because it ended unhappily." -- Bernard Schlink

item.title: Andy add a quote by Bernard Schlink
item.description: "So I stopped talking about it. There's no need to talk, because the truth of what one says lies in what one does." -- Bernard Schlink

item.title: Andy add a quote by Paulo Coelho
item.description: "And, when you want something, all the universe conspires in helping you to achieve it." -- Paulo Coelho

item.title: Andy add a quote by Paulo Coelho
item.description: "There is only one thing that makes a dream impossible to achieve: the fear of failure." -- Paulo Coelho

item.title: Andy add a quote by Stephen Crane
item.description: "It was not well to drive men into final corners; at those moments they could all develop teeth and claws." -- Stephen Crane
